member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.C1FlexGridBase.AllowFiltering
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the user is allowed to filter the data.

remarks.para: When this property is set to true, the grid displays filter icons on the column headers. Users may click the icons to define filters to be applied to the data.
When a filter is applied, the grid hides rows that don't match the filter by setting their property to false. The filter is not applied to the data source.
You may specify the type of filter to use for each individual column by setting the columns property.
You may also create custom filters by creating classes the implement the interface and assigning instances of that class to the column's property.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.C1FlexGridBase.IgnoreDiacritics
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether the filter should ignore diacritics (accents) when comparing values.

remarks.para: By default, the filter compares values as they appear in the data source. For example, if you are looking for values that contain the string "fac", you will find "factory" but not "façade".
If you set this property to true, the filter will remove any diacritics before performing the comparisons. In this case, looking for the string "fac" will return both "factory" and "façade".
This property is especially useful in applications localized for languages that contain many accents, such as French, Spanish, Portuguese, etc.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.C1FlexGridBase.FilterDefinition

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.CheckEnum
member.summary: Specifies the type of checkbox to draw in a cell.

remarks.para: There are two types of check boxes: regular and tri-state.
Regular check boxes are used to display simple Boolean values. They cycle through settings Checked and Unchecked when clicked with the mouse.
Tri-state check boxes are used to display values that may be true, false, or indeterminate (grayed). They cycle through settings TSChecked, TSGrayed, and TSUnchecked when clicked with the mouse.
Visually, Checked and Unchecked look the same as TSChecked and TSUnchecked.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.CheckEnum.None
member.summary: No check box.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.CheckEnum.Checked
member.summary: Check box with a check mark in it.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.CheckEnum.Unchecked
member.summary: Empty check box.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.CheckEnum.Grayed
member.summary: Check box in undefined state.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.CheckEnum.TSChecked
member.summary: Tri-state check box with a check mark in it.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.CheckEnum.TSUnchecked
member.summary: Tri-state empty check box.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.CheckEnum.TSGrayed
member.summary: Tri-state check box in undefined state.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.AggregateEnum
member.summary: Specifies the type of aggregate function to calculate with the and methods.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.AggregateEnum.None
member.summary: No aggregate. This setting is used with the method to create an outline tree without any numerical aggregates.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.AggregateEnum.Clear
member.summary: Clear existing aggregates. This setting is used with the method to clear any existing subtotals, usually before calculating new subtotals.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.AggregateEnum.Sum
member.summary: Returns the sum of all values in the range.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.AggregateEnum.Percent
member.summary: Percent of grand total. This setting is used with the method to calculate the percentage of the grand total represented by each sub group. (This setting can't be used with the method).

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.AggregateEnum.Count
member.summary: Returns the count of non-empty cells in a range.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.AggregateEnum.CountDistinct
member.summary: Returns the count of unique non-empty cells in a range.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.AggregateEnum.Average
member.summary: Returns the average value of the non-empty cells in a range.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.AggregateEnum.Max
member.summary: Returns the maximum value in a range.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.AggregateEnum.Min
member.summary: Returns the minimum value in a range.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.AggregateEnum.Std
member.summary: Returns the sample standard deviation of the values in a range (uses the formula based on n-1).

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.AggregateEnum.Var
member.summary: Returns the sample variance of the values in a range (uses the formula based on n-1).

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.AggregateEnum.StdPop
member.summary: Returns the population standard deviation of the values in a range (uses the formula based on n).

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.AggregateEnum.VarPop
member.summary: Returns the population variance of the values in a range (uses the formula based on n).

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.AggregateFlags
member.summary: Specifies options to use when calculating aggregates with the method.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.AggregateFlags.None
member.summary: Default setting. Include all rows and use numerical values only.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.AggregateFlags.ExcludeNodes
member.summary: Exclude node rows from aggregate. This option is useful when the grid contains subtotal rows, which are marked as nodes and contain values that are subtotals and should thus be excluded from aggregates.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.AggregateFlags.AggregateDates
member.summary: Calculate aggregates for dates instead of numerical values. Only a few aggregate functions are meaningful for dates: count, maximum, and minimum.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.AggregateFlags.AggregateBooleans
member.summary: Calculate aggregates for Boolean values. This flag causes the value True to be interpreted as one, and False as zero. This option is useful for counting the number of checked check boxes in a range.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.AggregateFlags.ExcludeHiddenCells
member.summary: Exclude hidden rows and columns from the aggregate.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.AggregateFlags.ExcludeCollapsedCells
member.summary: Exclude collapsed rows from the aggregate.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.AggregateFlags.ExcludeHiddenRows
member.summary: Exclude hidden rows from the aggregate.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.CellRange
member.summary: Represents cell ranges, allowing the caller to set properties for multiple cells with a single statement.

remarks.para: The structure does not have a public constructor. To create a object, use the method.

Note that is a structure, not a class. This means the object is used as a value, not as a reference. If you pass a to a method and change the object within that method, the original value is not modified.

member.summary: Gets a value that indicates if the range contains valid row and column indices.
member.remarks: This property returns true if the range coordinates are valid. The range is valid if both r1 and r2 are between 0 Rows.Count-1, both c1 and c2 are between 0 and Cols.Count-1.

member.summary: Gets the value in cell (, ), formatted as a string.
member.remarks: This property is similar to the property, except Clip returns a tab-delimited string containing data in the entire range, and DataDisplay returns the contents of the first cell only (r1, c1).

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.CellRange.Style
member.summary: Gets or sets the style used to display every cell in the range.
member.remarks: Getting or setting the range style ensures that every cell in the range has the same style. If the range does not contain any cells with custom styles, this property returns null.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.CellRange.StyleNew
member.summary: Gets or sets the style used to display every cell in the range, creating a new style if necessary.
member.remarks: This property never returns null. If the range does not have a style assigned to it, a new style will be created automatically.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.CellRange.StyleDisplay
member.summary: Gets the style used to render cell (, ).
member.remarks: This property never returns null. It will return the custom style assigned to the first cell in the range, to the cell's row, column, or a built-in style.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.CellRange.Checkbox
member.summary: Gets or sets the state of the checkbox in the range.
member.remarks: When getting, this property returns the checkbox value that corresponds to cell (, ). When setting, it applies the new value to all cells in the range.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.CellRange.Image
member.summary: Gets or sets the assigned to cells in the range.
member.remarks: When getting, this property returns the assigned to cell (, ). When setting, it applies the new value to all cells in the range.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.CellRange.UserData
member.summary: Gets or sets arbitrary used data assigned to cells in the range.
member.remarks: When getting, this property returns the user data assigned to cell (, ). When setting, it applies the new value to all cells in the range.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.CellRange.Clip
member.summary: Gets or sets a string containing the values of all cells in the range.

remarks.para: The cell values are delimited by characters specified by the property.
By default, columns are separated by tabs (\t or vbTab) and rows by line breaks (\n or vbCr).

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.DropModeEnum
member.summary: Specifies the behavior of the control as an OLE drag-drop target.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.DropModeEnum.None
member.summary: The control can't be used as a drop target.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.DropModeEnum.Manual
member.summary: The control fires drag-drop events that can be handled to provide drop target functionality.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.DropModeEnum.Automatic
member.summary: The control automatically handles dropping of text or filename data.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.DragModeEnum
member.summary: Specifies the behavior of the control as an OLE drag-drop source.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.DragModeEnum.Manual
member.summary: The control does not provide any drag support. The caller can still initiate drag-drop operations using the method.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.DragModeEnum.Automatic
member.summary: The control provides automatic dragging of data. If the mouse hovers near the edges of the selected range, the cursor will change and allow the user to move or copy data (pressing the CTRL key to copy).

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.DragModeEnum.AutomaticCopy
member.summary: Same as Automatic, except the data is always copied (never moved).

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.DragModeEnum.AutomaticMove
member.summary: Same as Automatic, except the data is always moved (never copied).

member.summary: Gets the object used to draw the cell. Use this object to draw custom elements in the cell.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.OwnerDrawCellEventArgs.Row
member.summary: Get the row index of the cell being painted.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.OwnerDrawCellEventArgs.Col
member.summary: Get the column index of the cell being painted.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.OwnerDrawCellEventArgs.Style
member.summary: Sets or sets the object used to paint the cell.

remarks.para: This parameter is often used to provide dynamic formatting based on cell contents. For example, if the cell contains a value outside a given range, the event handler may assign a new style to this parameter.
Although it is legal to modify the members of the parameter in this event, this is not recommended, since the change will affect other cells that may be using this style.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.OwnerDrawCellEventArgs.Bounds
member.summary: Get the rectangle where the cell will be painted (in client coordinates).

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.OwnerDrawCellEventArgs.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the text that will be displayed in the cell.
member.remarks: Changing this value is an easy way to modify the text displayed in a cell without any custom drawing code.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.OwnerDrawCellEventArgs.Image
member.summary: Gets or sets the image that will be displayed in the cell.
member.remarks: Changing this value is an easy way to modify the image displayed in a cell without any custom drawing code.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.OwnerDrawCellEventArgs.Measuring
member.summary: Gets a value that determines if the event was fired only to measure the cell.
member.remarks: This occurs while auto-sizing rows and columns, since the event handler may change the value displayed in the cell while handling this event.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.OwnerDrawCellEventArgs.Handled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the event has finished drawing the cell.

remarks.para: If this parameter is set to true, the grid assumes the call has been painted by the event handler. If it is set to false, the grid will paint the cell when the event returns.
Note that calling the method automatically sets this parameter to true.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.OwnerDrawCellEventArgs.DrawCell(C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.DrawCellFlags)
member.summary: Causes the grid to paint parts of the cell (background, foreground, border, etc.)
member.param: that specifies the parts of the cell.

remarks.para: This method is typically called in handlers when the code intends to draw some elements of the cell but not everything.

For example, the code may want to draw a custom border only. In this case, it could call e.DrawCell(DrawCellFlags.Background | DrawCellFlags.Content) to draw the cell background and content, and later draw the custom border. Or the code could want to draw a custom marker in a cell (like a note indicator in Excel). In this case, it should call e.DrawCell() to draw the entire cell, and later add the note marker (little red triangle on the top right corner of the cell).
If the owner-draw code draws the entire cell (including the background), then there's no need to call e.DrawCell at all.
This method uses for rendering fixed cells in handler.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.OwnerDrawCellEventArgs.DrawCell
member.summary: Causes the grid to paint the whole cell.

To determine whether a row is currently within view, check the and properties.
To determine whether a column is currently within view, check the and properties.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.RowCol.IsCollapsed
member.summary: Gets whether this row is collapsed.
member.remarks: Rows are collapsed when one of their parent nodes is collapsed. Collapsed rows are not visible to the user even if their property is set to true.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.RowCol.IsVisible
member.summary: Gets whether this row is currently visible to the user.

remarks.para: This property returns true if the property is set to true and the row is collapsed ( property returns false).

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.RowCol.Selected
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this row or column is selected.
member.remarks: Use this property to get or set the selection state for individual rows when the grid's property is set to .

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.RowCol.UserData
member.summary: Gets or sets user data associated with this row or column.
member.remarks: The UserData value is not used internally by the grid. It is reserved for additional data that the application may associate with rows or columns.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.RowCol.AllowDragging
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the user can drag this row or column with the mouse.

remarks.para: The grid object also has an property. If dragging is disabled at the grid level, the user will not be able to drag any rows or columns.
If dragging is allowed by the grid's property, then dragging of individual rows and columns can still be disabled by setting this property to false.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.RowCol.AllowResizing
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the user can resize this row or column with the mouse.

remarks.para: To resize rows or columns, the mouse must be over the fixed area of the grid, and close to a border between rows or columns. The mouse pointer will then change into a sizing pointer and the user can drag the row or column to change the row height or column width.
If a group of columns is selected (from first to last row) and the user resizes one of them, all selected columns are resized. The same applies to rows.
If column sizing is allowed, users may double-click the resizing area to resize a column so it will automatically fit the longest entry.
Rows with zero height and columns with zero width can't be resized by the user. If you want to make them very small but still resizable, set their height or width to one pixel, not to zero.

The and events fire before resizing starts, and may be used to prevent resizing of specific rows and columns. The and fire after resizing, and may be used to validate the user's action and to update the display.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.RowCol.AllowMerging
member.summary: Specifies whether adjacent cells with similar contents will be merged.

remarks.para: Merging cells allows you to display data in a clear, appealing way because it highlights groups of identical information. It also gives you flexibility to build tables similar to the ones you can create in HTML or using Microsoft Word, both of which support merged cells.
To create tables with merged cells, you must set the property to a value other than , and then set the property of individual rows and columns true for the rows and columns you wish to merge.
After these properties are set, the grid will automatically merge adjacent cells that have the same contents. Whenever the cell contents change, the grid updates the merging state.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.RowCol.AllowEditing
member.summary: Gets or sets whether cells on this row or column can be edited by the user.

remarks.para: The grid object also has an property. If editing is disabled at the grid level, the user will not be able to edit any cells.
If editing is allowed by the grid's property, then editing of individual rows and columns can still be disabled by setting this property to false.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.RowCol.DataType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of object stored in this row or column.

remarks.para: By default, the column's DataType property is set to , which allows you to store any data values in the column.

If you set a row or column's DataType to a specific type, the grid will try to convert any values assigned to cells in that column to the specified data type. If the conversion fails, the grid will fire a event and the cell value will not be changed.

The DataType property affects how values are stored internally in the grid, how they are sorted, and the type of control that is used to edit the values in the column. For example, a control is used to edit values in columns, and check boxes are used to display and edit values in Boolean columns.
If you want to store times (not dates) in a column, you can still use the DateTime type, but you should use a that displays only the time, not the date.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.RowCol.Format
member.summary: Gets or sets a string that specifies how to format the data on this column.

remarks.para: The Format property affects how values are formatted for display, not the values stored internally. To retrieve the formatted value of a cell, use the property.
The Format string has the same semantics as the format argument in the .NET method. For details and a complete set of examples, see the .NET documentation.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.RowCol.EditMask
member.summary: Gets or sets the input mask to use when editing cells on this column.
member.remarks: The grid also has an property that applies to the entire grid. For details and mask syntax, refer to that property.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.RowCol.Index
member.summary: Gets the index of this row or column in its parent collection.

remarks.para: This property returns -1 if the row or column is not a member of the collection.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.RowCol.Style
member.summary: Gets or sets a custom associated with this row or column.
member.remarks: If the row or column does not have a custom style, this property returns null.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.RowCol.StyleNew
member.summary: Gets or sets a custom associated with this row or column, creating a new style if necessary.
member.remarks: This property never returns null. If this element does not have a custom style, a new one will be created automatically and returned.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.RowCol.StyleDisplay
member.summary: Gets the style used to display this row or column.
member.remarks: This property never returns null. If the row or column has a custom style, this property returns that style. Otherwise, it returns the stock style used to display the row (e.g., Normal, Alternate, Fixed, Frozen).

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.RowCol.StyleFixed
member.summary: Gets the stock used to paint fixed cells in this row or column.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.RowCol.StyleFixedNew
member.summary: Gets the custom style associated with fixed cells on this row or column, creating a new one of necessary.
member.remarks: If the row or column has a custom style associated with its fixed cells, this property returns that style. Otherwise, it creates a new , assigns it to the row or column, and returns a reference to the new style.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.RowCol.StyleFixedDisplay
member.summary: Gets the style used to display fixed cells on this row or column.
member.remarks: If the row or column has a custom style associated with its fixed cells, this property returns that style. Otherwise, it returns the stock style used to display the column (e.g., Normal, Fixed).

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.RowCol.TextAlign
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines how text is aligned in scrollable cells on this row or column.
member.remarks: This property gets or sets the alignment value specified by the object associated with the column.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.RowCol.TextAlignFixed
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines how text is aligned in fixed cells on this row or column.
member.remarks: This property gets or sets the alignment value specified by the object associated with the fixed cells in the row or column.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.RowCol.ImageAlign
member.summary: Gets or sets an value that determines how images are aligned in scrollable cells on this row or column.
member.remarks: This property gets or sets the alignment value specified by the object associated with the column.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.RowCol.ImageAlignFixed
member.summary: Gets or sets an value that determines how images are aligned in fixed cells on this row or column.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.RowCol.ImageMap
member.summary: Gets or sets an object used to translate data values into images for this row or column.

remarks.para: Use this property to associate data values in this row or column with images. For example, if a column contains country names, you can use this property to display the corresponding flags.
Use the property to determine whether the image is displayed instead of or in addition to the cell text.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.RowCol.ImageAndText
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether images found in this row or column's should be displayed instead of or in addition to the cell text.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.RowCol.DataMap
member.summary: Gets or sets an object used to translate data values into display values for this row or column.

remarks.para: The DataMap property allows you to implement "translated" rows or columns. In translated rows or columns, the grid does not display the values stored in the cells. Instead, it looks up those values in the column's DataMap and displays the mapped value.
The grid also uses the DataMap value to populate drop-down lists when the column is editable.
Note that the DataMap property has no effect when the property is also set. Using both properties on a single row or column is legal, but it effectively disables the DataMap.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.RowCol.ComboList
member.summary: Gets or sets a list of items to be used by the drop-down editor.

remarks.para: The ComboList property specifies the type of editor to be used when editing a cell. You may use a text box, drop-down list, drop-down combo, or an edit button to pop up custom editor forms.
To use the ComboList property, set the property to True, and set the ComboList property to a string that describes the type of editing you want to use for that cell. The options are described below:
1. To edit the cell using a regular text box, set the ComboList property to an empty string ("").
2. To edit the cell using a drop-down list, set the ComboList property to a string containing the available options, separated by pipe characters (for example "option 1| option 2").

3. To edit the cell using a drop-down combo, set the ComboList property to a string containing the available options, separated by pipe characters and starting with a pipe character (for example "|option 1|option 2").

4. To display an edit button, set the ComboList property to a string containing an ellipsis ("..."). Edit buttons look like regular push buttons, aligned to the right of the cell, with an ellipsis as a caption. When the user clicks on the edit button, the grid fires the event. In this case, the user can't edit the cell contents directly.

5. To display an edit button next to an editable cell, set the ComboList property to a string containing a pipe and an ellipsis ("|..."). In this case, you get a regular edit button but the user can also edit the cell contents directly.
Note that the ComboList property has precedence over the property. Using both properties on a single row or column is legal, but it effectively disables the DataMap.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.RowCol.Editor
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom editor used to edit cells in this column.

remarks.para: The grid provides several built-in editors that are automatically selected based on the properties of the cell being edited.

This property allows you to use external editors when editing values in a given column. Any control can be used as an external editor, but to achieve complete integration with the grid, the external editor should implement the interface.
You can associate external editors with columns at design time (using the grid's Column Editor) or at run time, by setting this property.

example.para: The code below creates a C1DateEdit control and assigns it to the property of a grid column. The control will be used to edit cells on this column instead of the default control.
All controls in the C1Input library implement the interface and can be used as grid editors without any extra code.

To retrieve the size and position of a cell, use the method.

member.summary: Gets or sets the height of this row, in pixels (the value -1 represents the default row height).

remarks.para: Setting this property to -1 causes the grid to use the default row height for this row (see the property).
Height returns the height assigned to the row even if the row is invisible, and returns -1 if the row has the default height. To obtain the actual display height of a row, use the property.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.Row.HeightDisplay
member.summary: Gets or sets the display height for this row, in pixels.
member.remarks: HeightDisplay returns zero if the row is invisible, and returns the actual display height even if the property is set to -1 (which stands for default row height).

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.Row.DataIndex
member.summary: Gets the index of this row in the collection, excluding fixed and node rows.

remarks.para: This property returns -1 if the row is a fixed or node row.
If the grid is bound to a data source, the return value can be used as an indexer into the grid's data source to obtain a reference to the item bound to the row.
You can also obtain the underlying data object directly using the row's property.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.Row.DataSource
member.summary: Gets the object that provides data for this row.

remarks.para: The type of object returned depends on the type of DataSource assigned to the grid. For example, if the grid is bound to a object, then this property will return the specific object that is bound to this row.
This property returns null if the grid is unbound, or if the row is a fixed or node row that doesn't correspond to any objects in the grid's data source.
For an example, see the event.

remarks.para: Setting this property to -1 causes the grid to use the default column width for this column (see the property).
Width returns the width assigned to the column even if the row is invisible, and returns -1 if the row has the default height. To obtain the actual display width of a column, use the property.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.Column.StarWidth
member.summary:
Gets or sets a column's star-size, expressed in the format '{number}*'.
Star-sizing option performs a XAML-style dynamic sizing where column widths are proportional to the number before the star. For example, if a grid has three columns with widths "100", "*", and "3*", the first column will be 100 pixels wide, the second will take up 1/4th of the remaining space, and the last will take up the remaining 3/4ths of the remaining space.
Star-sizing allows you to define columns that automatically stretch to fill the width available. For example, set the width of the last column to "*" and it will automatically extend to fill the entire grid width so there's no empty space.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.Column.MinWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum width of the column to use when star-sizing is enabled ().

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.Column.MaxWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum width of the column to use when star-sizing is enabled ().

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.Column.Aggregate
member.summary: Gets or sets the aggregate to display on group rows for this column..

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.Column.WidthDisplay
member.summary: Gets or sets the display width for this column, in pixels.
member.remarks: WidthDisplay returns zero if the column is invisible, and returns the actual display width even if the property is set to -1 (which stands for default column width).

member.summary: Gets the index of this column in the collection.
member.remarks: This property is similar to the property, except it throws an exception if the is not a member of the collection.

member.remarks: This property returns -1 for fixed and unbound columns.

member.summary: Gets or sets that cells in the will accept null value or null will be replaced by default value in unbound mode.
member.remarks: This property works only if IsValueType member of property equals to True and for type . If value was changed to False then all null values in the will be replaced by defaults of current .

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.Column.AllowSorting
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this column can be sorted by clicking on the column header.
member.remarks: The grid has an property that determines whether columns can be sorted with the mouse. The AllowSorting property of the objects can be used to prevent the user from sorting specific columns.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.Column.AllowFiltering
member.summary: Gets or sets this type of filter to use for this column.

remarks.para: The grid has an property that determines whether columns can be filtered by the user. If that property is set to true, then filters are created automatically for each column based on the setting of the column's property.

The grid provides condition and value filters. Condition filters allow users to specify conditions such as 'value > 10'. Value filters allow users to select values that should be displayed from a list of values present in the data source. All filters can be customized in code as shown in the examples below.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.Column.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of this column.

remarks.para: The name can be used as an index in the property indexer.
When the grid is bound to a DataSource, the column names are set automatically to the names of columns in the data source, and are used for binding.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.Column.Sort
member.summary: Specifies how this column should be sorted when the method is called with a flag.
member.remarks: Use this property when you want to sort multiple columns in different orders. For example, you could set the Sort property to for columns 1, 2, and 3, and to for columns 4, 5, and 6. You would then call the grid's method with the sort parameter set to to perform the sort using the order specified for each column.

member.summary: Specifies the type of selection provided by the grid.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.SelectionModeEnum.Default
member.summary: The user can select continuous blocks of cells using the keyboard and the mouse. Clicking on header cells selects entire rows and columns.

member.summary: The user can select only a single cell at a time.

member.summary: The user can select continuous blocks of cells using the keyboard and the mouse. Clicking on header cells does not affect the selection.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.SelectionModeEnum.Row
member.summary: The user can select a single row at a time.

member.summary: The user can select a range of contiguous rows at a time.

member.summary: The user can select a single column at a time.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.SelectionModeEnum.ColumnRange
member.summary: The user can select a range of contiguous columns at a time.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.SelectionModeEnum.ListBox
member.summary: The user can select non-contiguous rows using control-click.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.CellStyleEnum.Normal
member.summary: Style used to render scrollable normal cells.

remarks.para: This is the parent style for most cells. Setting the control's BackColor, ForeColor, or Font properties automatically sets the corresponding properties on the Normal style.
If you change any properties in the Normal style, the changes will be reflected in all styles that do not explicitly override those properties.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.CellStyle
member.summary: The class encapsulates properties that control the appearance of grid cells. This information includes the background and foreground colors, font, text and image alignment, etc.

remarks.para: The property exposes a collection of grid styles, and has methods for creating and removing styles from the grid.
You can create and define styles at design time, but right-clicking the grid and selecting the "Edit Styles" menu option.

Styles follow a hierarchical model similar to styles in Microsoft Word or in cascading style sheets. Every property in a object may be left unassigned, in which case the value is inherited from a parent style. The parent style is usually the built-in style.
To determine which elements are defined in a particular style, use the property.
When you modify the properties of a object, all cells that use that style are automatically repainted to reflect the changes.
Styles may be assigned to , , and objects, as shown in the example below.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.CellStyle.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the style name.

remarks.para: Style names must be unique. Setting a style name to the name of an already existing style will throw an exception.
Style names must have one or more characters and may not include curly braces ('{' and '}').

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.CellStyle.BackColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color used to paint the cell background.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.CellStyle.ForeColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the text in the cell.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.CellStyle.SearchBackColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the text in the cell.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.CellStyle.Font
member.summary: Gets or sets the font used to paint text in the cell.
member.remarks: Setting the control's Font property automatically sets the Font property of the Normal style.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.CellStyle.Margins
member.summary: Gets or sets the margins between the edges of the cell and its contents, in pixels.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.CellStyle.WordWrap
member.summary: Gets or sets whether long strings should automatically wrap within the cell.

remarks.para: This property determines whether the grid should automatically break long strings that contain spaces and display them in multiple lines.
String that contain hard line breaks (vbCrLf or "\n\r") are always displayed in multiple lines.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.CellStyle.Trimming
member.summary: Gets or sets how long strings are trimmed to fit the cell.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.CellStyle.TextAlign
member.summary: Gets or sets the text alignment.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.CellStyle.TextEffect
member.summary: Gets or sets the 3D effect used to paint text.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.CellStyle.TextDirection
member.summary: Gets or sets the text direction.
member.remarks: Cells containing vertical text can wrap and be auto sized as usual.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.CellStyle.ImageAlign
member.summary: Gets or sets the image alignment.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.CellStyle.ImageSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the space between images and text in a cell, in pixels.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.CellStyle.Display
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to show images, text, or both.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.CellStyle.Format
member.summary: Gets or sets the format string used to display values.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.CellStyle.EditMask
member.summary: Gets or sets the mask string used to edit values.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.CellStyle.ComboList
member.summary: Gets or sets a pipe-delimited list of valid values.

remarks.para: If the cell is editable, this list of values is used to populate the drop-down used to edit the cell.
If the list starts with a pipe character, then the list is not exclusive and the user may type values that are not on the list.
If the list contains three periods ("..."), then a button is displayed in the cell. When the user presses the button, the grid fires the event.
If the list contains a pipe followed by three periods ("|..."), then a button is displayed in the cell as before, and the user may also type into the cell.
See also the property for an alternate way of specifying valid values for a cell.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.CellStyle.ImageMap
member.summary: Gets or sets an used to associate cell values with images.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.CellStyle.DataMap
member.summary: Gets or sets an used to associate cell values with display values.

remarks.para: If the cell is editable, this list of values is used to populate the drop-down used to edit the cell. In this case, the order of the items in the combo list is determined by the order of the elements in the dictionary.
The most common dictionary class, , uses arbitrary order. If you want control over the item order, use a different dictionary class such as .
The C1FlexGrid assembly also includes a class, which can be used to create multi-column and data-bound dictionaries.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.CellStyle.DataType
member.summary: Gets or sets the data type for the style.

remarks.para: When the grid is bound to a data source, this property is set automatically based on the data schema.
This property is used to coerce values assigned to cells into the proper type.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.CellStyle.Border
member.summary: Gets the CellBorder object associated with this style.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.CellStyle.Editor
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom editor used to edit cells that have this style.

remarks.para: The grid provides several built-in editors that are automatically selected based on the properties of the cell being edited.

This property allows you to use external editors when editing values that have a given . Any control can be used as an external editor, but to achieve complete integration with the grid, the external editor should implement the interface.
For details, see the property.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.CellStyle.UserData
member.summary: Gets or sets arbitrary user data associated with this style.
member.remarks: This data is not used by the control, and can be used to store any data that is useful to the application.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.CellStyle.BackgroundImage
member.summary: Gets or sets the style's background image.

remarks.para: This property works with to determine whether and how background images are rendered in cells.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.CellStyle.BackgroundImageLayout
member.summary: Gets or sets the a value that determines how the style will scale and position background image.

remarks.para: This property works with to determine whether and how background images are rendered in cells.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.CellStyle.DefinedElements
member.summary: Gets or sets which elements are defined in this style.
member.remarks: Elements that are not defined in a particular style are automatically inherited from the ancestor style (usually the Normal style). For example, if you create a custom style that defines the property, all other elements (back color, alignment, and so on) are inherited from the ancestor style, which may be the Normal style or another custom style assigned to a row or column.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.CellStyle.Clear(C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.StyleElementFlags)
member.summary: Clears selected elements from this style.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.CellStyle.Clear

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.Util.BaseControls.ScrollableControl
member.summary: Base class for controls that support auto-scrolling behavior.
member.remarks: This class is similar to , but provides extra customization, better scroll notification, and support for scroll tracking.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.Util.BaseControls.ScrollableControl.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of a class.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.Util.BaseControls.ScrollableControl.ScrollBars
member.summary: Gets or sets which scroll bars should appear on the control.

remarks.para: Scroll bars are displayed only if the contents of the control extend beyond its client area. For example, if is set to , a horizontal scroll bar is displayed only if the control is not wide enough to display all columns at once.
Even when it has no scrollbars, the control will still scroll to keep the selection visible. If you want to prevent scrolling, handle the event and set its parameter to true.
You can force the control to display scrollbars at all times with the property.
You can determine which scrollbars are currently visible with the property.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.Util.BaseControls.ScrollableControl.ScrollPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the location of the auto-scroll position.

remarks.para: Use the property to get or set the scroll position using pixel coordinates.
Use the and properties to get or set the scroll position using cell coordinates.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.Util.BaseControls.ScrollableControl.BorderStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of border around the control.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.Util.BaseControls.ScrollableControl.ScrollBarsVisible
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates which scrollbars are currently visible.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.Util.BaseControls.ScrollableControl.BeginUpdate
member.summary: Maintains performance by preventing the control from updating itself until the method is called.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.Util.BaseControls.ScrollableControl.EndUpdate
member.summary: Resumes updating the control after calls to the method.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.Util.BaseControls.ScrollableControl.DeferUpdate
member.summary: Suspends notifications until the returned object is disposed.
member.returns: An object that must be disposed to restore notifications.
member.remarks: This method is typically used in update blocks to perform batch updates efficiently and safely.

example.para: The example below shows how you can use the DeferUpdate method to suspend notifications while setting the width of several columns.

Note that the call to the DeferUpdate method is placed in a using statement, which automatically disposes of the object and restores updates at the end of the block, even if the code within the block throws an exception. This makes the code more readable and concise than calling the more traditional BeginUpdate and EndUpdate methods within a try/finally block.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.Util.BaseControls.ScrollableControl.VerticalScrollBarIsVisible
member.summary: Gets the state of vertical scrollbar.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.Util.BaseControls.ScrollableControl.VerticalScrollBarWidth
member.summary: Gets the width of vertical scrollbar.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.Util.BaseControls.ScrollableControl.OnThemeChanged
member.summary: Called when the control receives a WM_THEMECHANGED message.
member.remarks: The WM_THEMECHANGED message is broadcast to every window following a theme change event. Examples of theme change events are the activation of a theme, the deactivation of a theme, or a transition from one theme to another.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1FlexGrid.Util.BaseControls.ScrollableControl.OnImeStartComposition
member.summary: Called when the control receives a WM_IME_STARTCOMPOSITION message.
member.remarks: The WM_IME_STARTCOMPOSITION message is sent immediately before the IME generates the composition string as a result of a keystroke. The message is a notification to an IME window to open its composition window. An application should process this message if it displays composition characters itself.
